[{"id":"8ce8afdb-f0c1-4662-a49e-1d3122c86fdc","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Function: find_cls_fun_ns","styles":{"bold":true}}],"children":[]},{"id":"441e4990-5ea8-4637-8079-369b9a98746d","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Description
","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":"The ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"find_cls_fun_ns","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" function is the inheritance-aware lookup engine for class methods. Its primary responsibility is to resolve a method name (e.g., ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"save","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":") starting from a specific class, while respecting the Method Resolution Order (MRO). If a method isn't found in the current class, the function systematically searches through its parent classes. Crucially, it also handles the "binding" of the ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"self","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" variable, ensuring that any method found—even one high up in the inheritance chain—correctly associates ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"self","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" with the actual class being analyzed.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"da5e1b51-e9d2-4c6e-9ddf-da9caf69d725","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Why this matters
","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":"Inheritance is a core feature of Python that complicates static analysis. If ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"AdminUser","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" inherits from ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"User","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":", and ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"User","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" defines a ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"login()","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" method, a call to ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"AdminUser.login()","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" must be traced back to the code in the parent ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"User","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" class. This function performs that trace. Without it, the analyzer would fail to find methods defined in base classes, leading to incomplete call graphs and unresolved data flows.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"54843114-dc91-4e65-8ac8-f74edce6aae8","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"How it Class Metadata:","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" It looks up the ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"ClassNode","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" for the given class namespace (","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"clsNs","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":") via the ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"class_manager","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":".","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"4eb96d7b-cb1e-4aed-b853-c6d6ca8f7778","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"MRO Traversal:","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" It iterates through the class's MRO—a pre-calculated list that defines the order in which Python searches for attributes (e.g., ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"[AdminUser, User, object]","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":").","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"e76e0495-417d-421a-adcc-07c2635c0d38","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Scoped Search:","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" For each class in the MRO:","styles":{}}],"children":[{"id":"d1586333-c53b-40d7-aeca-ec8d91f40cc1","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"It retrieves the class's scope.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"7d16bd35-28bd-4dc2-86d7-4fe5006f273e","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"It checks if the target method name (","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"fn","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":") exists as a definition in that scope.","styles":{}}],"children":[]}]},{"id":"ef9cd359-a08c-4969-a529-aaf190602cff","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"self","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" Binding:","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" When the method is found, the function performs a critical update: it locates the ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"self","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" definition within that method's scope and adds a "value point" linking it to the current class (","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"clsNs","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":"). This ensures that inside the parent's method, the analyzer knows ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"self","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" refers to the child class instance.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"3e0b8e5e-4065-4d4f-8f50-e8c526b5fa32","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Output:","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" It returns the ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"Definition","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" object for the resolved method or ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"None","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" if the method cannot be found anywhere in the hierarchy.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"a706ffbf-9ae2-42e3-a591-787930fce99b","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Example Scenario
","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":"Consider:","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"2157a934-9c87-4d23-b221-5633080794a2","type":"codeBlock","props":{"language":"python"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"class Base:
    def run(self): pass

class Worker(Base):
